wikipedia_page.main: Valia Venitshaya (December 19, 1899 in Whitechapel, London, England June 26, 1993 in San Jose, California) was a British actress of the silent era.

response: |The Audacious Mr. Squire||Edwin Greenwood||Jack Buchanan, Valia||Comedy||

The Great Prince Shan is a 1924 British silent drama film directed by A.E. Coleby and featuring Sessue Hayakawa, Ivy Duke, Tsuru Aoki, Valia, David Hawthorne, Fred Raynham and Henry Vibart in important roles. The film is adapted from the 1922 novel of the same title by E. Phillips Oppenheim. It was made at Cricklewood Studios by Stoll Pictures, the largest British production company of the era. Location shooting took place on the French Riviera.Nelmes p.331 It was one of two films former Hollywood star Hayakawa made for Stoll along with Sen Yan's Devotion released later the same year.
* Valia Venitshaya, British actress of the silent era
* Valia Barak (born 1969), Peruvian journalist and television presenter
* Valia (wasp), a genus of insects in the family Diapriidae
* Valia College, an education institute in Mumbai, India
The Green Caravan is a 1922 British silent drama film directed by Edwin J. Collins and starring Catherine Calvert, Gregory Scott and Valia.Low p.377
Shifting Sands is a 1922 American silent drama film directed by Fred LeRoy Granville and starring Peggy Hyland, Louis Willoughby and Valia.Munden p.708
